content.description:
A fantastic route with an unfortunate name that has been abbreviated in this entry. From below a square boulder climb a left trending crack system to the top of the cliff. Very fun movement for the grade and good protection throughout.



On the right side of the crag, a square detached flake/boulder marks the start which gets you into the crack system on the right.

Standard rack to BD #3.

This route climbs directly between the cracks of Left Ski Track and Right Ski Track up a minor crack with a hard to see piton about 6 meters above the ledge system. Shares the anchor with Right Ski Track. Directly between the cracks of Left Ski Track and Right Ski Track. Standard rack, small pieces for the lower half.

This route is basically a sport route with 7 bolts. A small nut or micro cam can be used to tame some of the bigger gaps between bolts. Climb the obvious line of bolts to the right of the Right Ski Track crack, if belaying from the ledge anchor you can traverse in over Right Ski Track to reach the first bolt. At the 6th bolt the line climbs left of the overlap, going around the bolt rather than straight up over the bulge. The bolt line immediately right of Right Ski Track. Small nuts and a microcam or two, or just 7 quickdraws.

One of the most aesthetically appealing lines at the crag. Scramble up to a ledge system right below the crack and belay off of an intermediate two bolt anchor for the best experience. You can lower off the top with a single 70m rope to the intermediate anchors, be very careful if trying this with a 60m.



The obvious striking orange crack that is above you as the trail meets the wall. 

Standard rack to BD #3.

One of the more unique places to climb in Kananaskis Country, this crag is a hidden gem with some big walls, moderate climbing and a 60 second approach. The rock is conglomerate, and while some routes have occasional bolts, a standard rack is needed. Some climbs can be done and rappeled using a single rope and an intermediate anchor, but it's best to bring a second rope to be able to do full 60m rappels.
